About Contact Open Hours

We specialize in vintage guitars from the 1950s and 1960s, and have a unique and rare collection on display. Come visit us to learn about the history and culture behind these iconic instruments, and experience the amazing sounds they produce.

We're proud to showcase:


> a rare Gibson Les Paul Goldtop that was played by legendary blues musician B.B. King during a historic concert at the Fillmore Auditorium in 1968


> a Fender Stratocaster that was used by Jimi Hendrix during his performances at the Monterey Pop Festival in 1967


> a Gretsch Country Gentleman that was favored by George Harrison of The Beatles during the band's heyday in the 1960s


Join us at the museum to explore these incredible instruments and learn about the rich history of music in San Francisco.

Come join us at our caf√© and bar, where you can enjoy live music from 6pm until midnight. Immerse yourself in the best vintage guitar riffs of all time while sipping on a refreshing drink.
